column1: wide outswinger on a fullish length, and Guptill gets down on his back knee and has a proper old slash at that. He's nowhere near connecting, and the umpire signals wide
back of a length, close to off stump, a bit of shape away. Gets back and across and defends towards cover point
fuller this time, curves away from the fourth-stump line, left alone
back of a length, straightens towards middle stump. Gets on his toes to ride the bounce and defend back down the pitch
back of a length outside off, doesn't quite come onto the bat for the horizontal-bat slap. Hits it hard into the ground and it rolls slowly into the point region

first runs off the bat, and it's a boundary. Back of a length again, not too much width, and a bit of extra bounce. Looks to punch off the back foot and it hits high on the bat, near the outside edge, and runs away quickly to the left of Ben Stokes at backward point
back of a length, a little closer to off stump, left alone
length ball, straightens a little towards top of off, defended to midwicket
similar length, a touch too straight, worked off the hip to fine leg
back of a length on off stump, gets behind it to tuck it towards square leg. He wants one - the fielder is pretty much on the edge of the circle - but Nicholls sends him back
length ball, nips back a little towards middle stump, worked away to the left of long leg

got him, what a beaut! Or did he edge that at all? Squared him up in defence with late movement from the shorter side of a good length, on a tight off-stump line. Replays show the ball has sneaked past the outside edge and hit the pocket of Guptill's trousers on the way to the keeper. England trust in Marais Erasmus' not-out decision and decide not to review, wisely so.
length ball on off stump, blocked back to the bowler
back of a length on leg stump, tucked off the hip to square leg
slants this one across, pitching just outside off on a fullish length. No swing back in, and Nicholls ignores it

ooh, this one does come back in, and Kumar Dharmasena doesn't wait too long to raise his finger to Woakes' lbw appeal. Nicholls reviews. Lovely length, fullish but not full enough to bring out a proper front-foot stride, and Nicholls is stuck on the crease, playing down the wrong line, looking for the straight-bat defensive push to mid-on. Beats the inside edge, and hits back thigh pad. The ball pitched on a middle-and-leg line, and straightened, but the bounce would have taken it over the stumps, according to ball-tracking. Wow!
length ball, straightening towards middle and off. Gets in half a stride this time and defends, with ball hitting the inside half of the bat
a touch shorter on off stump, worked away with the swing through square leg
back of a length, this one keeps going with the angle, pitching on middle and finishing just outside off stump. Gets nicely back and across to defend into the covers
back of a length, a bit of nip back towards off stump, defended into the on side off the back foot

digs this in short, rising shoulder high outside off, and Guptill stays leg-side of the ball, lets the ball come to him, and deliberately slices underneath the ball to uppercut over the boundary fine of third man
back of a length outside off, left alone

wham. A shimmy out of his crease this time, and he converts Archer's length ball into a half-volley, and extends his arms through the line to drive it back past the startled bowler, at shoulder height
length ball, angling into middle and leg, tucked away to fine leg
length ball on leg stump, stays on the back foot and pushes to the left of midwicket, with a straight bat, for a quick single
fullish, slanting across into the fifth-stump channel, left alone
shortish outside off, jumps up to ride the bounce and chops it down to third man

fullish, angling into middle stump. Guptill comes forward and plays a little uncertainly, looking to clip through the leg side while playing for a bit of outswing. Doesn't swing, and a thick inside edge runs away towards long leg
shortish outside off, jumps up again and jabs to backward point
length ball slanting away from off stump, gets a stride forward and punches towards backward point
length ball attacking the top of off stump. Gets back and across to defend into the covers
back of a length on off stump, uses his wrists to tuck it into the short midwicket region and they immediately set off for the single, with the bowler having to run across and field it himself
back of a length, fairly close to off stump, hops across to push into the cover point region
length ball on middle and leg, clipped away through backward square leg
length ball on middle and off, defended towards mid-off

good ball, a bit of movement in from just short of a length. Pitches on about leg stump and straightens from there. Looks to work it through the leg side and the ball beats his inside edge and hits thigh pad
similar ball, back of a length and straightening towards middle and leg. Tucked away to the left of midwicket this time
length ball, swings back in late, towards middle and leg, as Nicholls looks to push forward and defend. Inside-edge onto pad, and runs away wide of second slip

Given! And Guptill consults with his partner for an age before reviewing with a couple of seconds left on the clock. Length ball, nips back in off the seam, and Guptill, looking to drive on the up through mid-off, is beaten on the inside edge. Hits the bent back leg, just above the flap of the pads. Impact is in line with middle and off, and the ball is hitting middle stump two-thirds of the way up. Why did he review that if there was no edge? Chris Woakes gets the first wicket of the World Cup final, with a lovely delivery that went off the seam in the opposite direction to how he usually swings it
greets him with a fifth-stump outswinger, and Williamson gets on the front foot and leaves it alone
again the line is fifth stump. A good-length ball with a bit of late outswing, and Williamson won't be tempted into playing at it
length ball angling into off stump, defended off the front foot into the point region

ooh, lovely. This one's not as full as the previous ball, and it's pitched in the fourth-stump channel. Williamson is unsure whether to play or leave, and he kind of ends up halfway between the two as the ball straightens past his outside edge
shortish, and there's some extra bounce at 145kph. Straightens into Nicholls from a middle-and-leg line, and the ball beats the inside edge of his defensive bat and hits him on the stomach

back of a length, close to off stump. Jumps back and across to defend, and the ball straightens and hits the inside half of the bat and rolls gently between his legs. He has no idea where the ball is, but Williamson calls for a quick single and he immediately responds
short ball, rising to shoulder height in the corridor outside off, Williamson leaves it, swaying his upper body out of the way

ooh, that's massive outswing, most of it after passing the edge. Lovely length, fourth-stump line, and Williamson is half-forward to defend, and the ball swings past the edge and then swings some more before reaching the keeper
bouncer, rising steeply and without apparent effort over middle and off. Ducks his head and shoulders hurriedly out of the way
length ball close to off stump, defended with soft hands into the cover point region. Thinks of the quick single, but the fielder rushing in makes him decide against it
length ball slanting across to off stump, defended to mid-off. Not much footwork there, just played that from the crease while staying nice and compact
this one isn't compact at all. Back of a length, widish line outside off, and he has a big slash at it away from his body and misses
back of a length, straightens into the fourth-stump channel, gets back and across for the straight-bat punch down the pitch

overpitched, but Nicholls can't find the gap with his drive. Hits it to the right of mid-off, not far enough to beat him, and sets off for a quick single. Has to stretch at the end to beat Roy's throw at the non-striker's end. Doesn't hit the stumps and he'd probably have been just in anyway
good-length ball with a bit of outswing, just outside off stump. Gets forward, head over ball, and defends with soft hands
back of a length outside off, left alone
length ball close to off stump, gets behind it and defends back to the bowler

this isn't the easiest pitch to bat on. Back of a length, straightens into Nicholls from a leg-stump line with a bit of extra bounce. Beats the inside edge of his attempted flick and hits him on the thigh pad
length ball wide of off stump, looks like the offcutter, but it pitches too wide to make Williamson play
length ball angling into off stump, leans forward and meets the ball right under his eye to tuck it gently to the right of midwicket

appeal for lbw, and Nicholls shows the umpire his bat. Bounce may have taken it over the stumps too. Pitches just short of a length on middle or thereabouts, and straightens in past the back-foot defensive. May have kissed inside edge through to thigh pad
length ball on middle and off, defended back to the bowler
back of a length, nips in a little but down the leg side. Williamson thinks of a flick, but decides to lift his bat over his head in the end
back of a length outside off, chopped down to third man
a bit of movement in from outside off. Nicholls shuffles across to work it leg side, but the ball beats his inside edge and hits his pad
rare gimme ball. Short and wide, and Nicholls slaps it away to the left of backward point
and Woakes goes wide again, fuller this time. Gets on the front foot to slap to the newly stationed deep point fielder
back of a length, nips back slightly towards off stump, goes on the back foot to defend back to the bowler
length ball, fifth-stump line, left alone
fullish on off stump, met with a checked drive to mid-off
length ball close to off stump, gets forward for the push to the right of extra-cover. Woakes' throw at the keeper's end has no one backing up inside the circle, and they run an overthrow
back of a length, nips in off the pitch as Nicholls goes back and across to try and work it leg side. Hits his thigh pad again
short, gets up to about chest height outside off stump, pulled away to the right of deep square leg
full outside off, drives firmly but straight to short extra-cover
full and on the pads, flicked away to the left of deep square leg
length ball close to off stump, defended into the point region
full outside off, lets it come on and plays a checked drive to short extra-cover
back of a length, ends up slanting a fair way down the leg side, past the attempted flick off the hip
ooh, lovely delivery, the nip-backer from a perfect length, against the slope. Height the issue, though, as Williamson steps across to defend and is beaten on the inside edge
a bit fuller on off stump, driven firmly back to the bowler
length ball close to off stump, shuffles across and dabs to backward point
fullish, angling into off stump, defended to short extra
length ball outside off, his weight isn't fully forward as he looks to drive through the covers, ends up slicing it towards third man
short and wide, and he gets across to cut, but straight to backward point

ooh, offcutter on off stump, on a fullish length. Comes forward, initially looking to drive down the ground, and catches up with the offcutter a little late with a twirl of the wrists. Runs away through square leg off the inside half of the bat
shortish outside off, chopped to third man
another offcutter, back of a length outside off. Stops on Williamson and he chops it away to deep point

they've taken a bunch of singles and Plunkett's had to keep changing his angle as a result. Sends down a full one on the pads and Nicholls puts it away with a flick to the backward square leg boundary
full, wide outswinger, and Williamson chases it with a big drive and misses. Harsh call of wide, maybe
wide-ish line again, more outswing, but this one's shorter. Williamson has an uncharacteristic jab at it away from his body, and misses
lovely. Angles this into the fourth-stump channel and swings it away from a good length. Left alone
full-toss, about half a stump high, angling into off stump and curving away late. Williamson flicks it back to the bowler - may have initially been aiming through midwicket
shortish, a bit of width, punched to deep point
fullish, swinging down leg, misses the flick and the ball rolls off the pad to fine leg. 153kph!
shortish, angling down leg. Looks to flick initially, and then decides against it

short, angling down leg but not as far. A little shorter than the previous ball too, and Williamson swivels to hook it fine, to the left of the keeper. I suspect it came off glove, but Williamson won't mind that

short and slanting into the hips from round the stumps, Nicholls sizes up this one on the back foot. Swivel-pulled away to the left of deep square leg. Has the sliding Stokes done his half at the boundary?
good length and outside off, blocked off the front foot
much fuller and outside off, driven through the line to mid-off
pitched up and outside off, another fluent front-foot drive, but can't get it past extra-cover
back of a length and angling into the pads, picked away between long leg and deep square leg
pitched up and holds its line outside off, Williamson leans into a charming front-foot drive but finds mid-off at the edge of the circle
good length and skids back in against the angle from over the wicket, 148ks, Nicholls is late onto it and is pinged on the thigh pad
shorter and angling away outside off, Nicholls rides the bounce and guides it to point
shortish and darts back in at off stump, Nicholls hops and jabs it away just wide of short midwicket to pick up a single
wide of the crease, back of a length and angling in at off, 149ks, Williamson goes back and across, defensively pushing the ball down to mid-on
wide of the crease, even shorter at the body, Williamson leaps and fends a single to the right of mid-on
good length and tight on off, Nicholls replies with an equally tight front-foot defence, getting right behind the line and showing off his straight bat
tossed outside off, no turn either way, Williamson stretches out and drives a single down to long-off
pushed through on off stump, Nicholls goes well to jump across the stumps and paddle-sweep a single down to fine leg
Rashid dangles up a legbreak outside off, Williamson does not allow it to turn, venturing down the track and driving smoothly to long-off
slides on leg stump,looks like an attempted wrong'un, Nicholls brings out the sweep again. Rolls his wrists and strokes it to long leg
flighted on middle, Williamson doesn't get quite get underneath the length. Slices it in the air over midwicket
skids on outside off, spins away late, Williamson reads it and dabs with the break through point
chest-high short ball, slanting in from over the wicket, Williamson controls a pull to Rashid at long leg

short and angling across off, 145ks, Nicholls rides the bounce. He opens the face and delightfully punches it to the right of backward point, then beats deep third man to his left and sweeper to his right in the deep
back of a length and much straighter, Nicholls sits back and tickles a single through the square-leg region
wide of the crease, back of a length and holds its line outside off. There's a wide slip in place, but Williamson dabs it away past him and finds deep third man
lifter, rising steeply at the throat of Nicholls, on middle, the batsman leaps off his feet. Keeps his eyes locked on the ball and fends it off to cover
back of a length and skidding away outside off, Nicholls has an almighty swish with his feet rooted to the crease. The ball sneaks under his bat-swing
flighted on off stump, Williamsom stretches out, gets close to the pitch. In the previous Rashid over, he sliced under it, this time he nails it against the break in the air over mid-on's right. Four
full, drifts in towards off stump, breaks away, Williamson adjusts, opening the bat-face and dinking it to point
tossed up slower and higher on off, Williamson is forward to smother it
fuller and straighter, Williamson rolls his wrists and sweeps it flat to the right of deep square. Archer tidies up in the outfield
back of a length, flatter and outside off, Williamson jumps back and punches off the back foot to the covers
looks like a wrong'un, but it's short on middle, allowing Williamson to punch it down to long-on off the back foot

slightly overpitched and outside off, Williamson leans into it and drives with an open face. Carsessed through the covers. Bairstow slides to his right at the edge of the boundary and hauls the ball in. Top work in the outfield
dug in short and skidding in to strike Nicholls on the thigh pad as he falls over the leg-side flick
Nicholls jumps across off, gets closer to this short ball outside off and laces it away square of Rashid at deep third man
hip-high short ball outside off, swatted off the back foot to deep midwicket
shortish and slanting in around off from over the wicket, Williamson allows the ball to come onto him. Then opens the face so very late, and pats it away towards point
on a length and straightens a bit outside off, rare false stroke from Williamson. He aims to drive on the up, instead slices a thick outside edge past slip. It rolls down to deep third man
on the pads, Williamson picks it away to left of deep square leg. Archer is the boundary-rider there
tossed up slower and outside off, Nicholls uses his feet and scoops a drive to mid-off down the ground. Hundred up for NZ
flighted and turns in on off stump, Williamson quietly bunts to short midwicket's right. Rashid isn't quite ripping the googly today
here comes Nicholls: down the track, takes this full ball from middle stump and drills a drive to long-on
good length, starts on off and spins away a wee bit, jabbed back to the bowler
full on off, Williamson jabs it back to Rashid
on a length and angling across off, Nicholls stands up tall and punches serenely with a high elbow but can't get it past short cover
full and straight, tapped to mid-on. Nicholls and Williamson take on Archer's arm for an urgent single
pitched up and holds its line outside off, Williamson opens the face and creams it away, but Morgan swoops down on the ball at short cover

Plunkett thinks he has Williamson. Umpire Dharmasena does not budge. Morgan wants a review. Good length, angling in towards off from over the wicket, kicking up and nipping away outside off. Williamson is undone by the cross-seamer as he drives at it fairly away from his body. Replays indicate that the ball moves away just enough, scratches the outside edge and Buttler gobbles that up. Plunkett returns to the attack and claims the prize scalp of Williamson. That's why England pick him ahead of Moeen
fuller and on middle, defensively pushed to mid-on
pitched up and holds its line outside off, Taylor inches forward and pushes it to cover
flighted on off stump, Nicholls bends forward and defends to cover
pushed through on leg stump, down the track and whipped firmly to long-on
wrong'un, full on middle, Taylor picks it off the pitch and turns it away through square leg
looks like another wrong'un, sliding across off, draws the outside edge and rolls down to third man
on the pads, picked away fine of short fine leg
on a length and breaks away outside off, Taylor stabs it away to the left of Rashid
short and wide outside off, lashed away straight to backward point
back of a length and angling across off, wristed away through backward square leg
good length and slanting in just outside off, Taylor presses forward and prods it to cover
much fuller and skidding in at off, Taylor gets into a tangle and pokes to cover once again
looks like another cross-seamer, but this does not bounce much. Short, outside off, but sneaks under Taylor's cut
back of a length and skidding in at off, Taylor gets forward, loosens his grip, and fends it back to the bowler
tossed on middle, Nicholls steps out, drives to long-on, and raises a solid half-century in the final
glanced away through square leg for one
flatter and on the pads, swept flat and hard to deep square leg
Taylor jumps down the track, gets too close to the pitch, and stabs it back to Rashid
Taylor jumps down the track once again, this time he bunts a single down to long-on
tossed up and spins in on middle, Nicholls leaves his crease and works a single into the midwicket region
fullish and on off stump, Nicholls solidly plays back to the bowler
even fuller and on a fourth-stump line, stabbed away off the toe-end straight of mid-on
pitched up and outside off, drilled away through the covers. Just one man in the deep on the off side. Stokes who is sweeping the boundary runs across to his left and cuts it off
back of a length and holds its line outside off, Taylor glides it down to deep third man

What a double-strike from Plunkett! Back of a length and swerves back in after starting just outside off. It's the cross-seam variety once again. A crease-bound Nicholls aims to punch through the covers off the back foot, but is cramped for room. He winds up dragging on. The leg bail is tipped off. Plunkett has taken down both Williamson and Nicholls
fullish and outside off, forward and driven down to mid-off
tossed on middle, Taylor aims leg-side and leading-edges it through cover-point
down the track comes Taylor, Rashid holds this one back. Taylor quietly knocks it away to the leg side
shorter and breaks in on middle, punched away through backward square off the back foot
flat and full on off, eased down to long-on for one
tossed slower and higher on middle, driven to Rashid's left towards long-on
wrong'un, chipped in the air but does not carry to short midwicket
good length and nibbling away outside off, Latham covers his off stump and shoulders arms
Plunkett hits that in-between length again, slanting away outside off, Latham looks to force the ball through cover and ends up inside-edging it onto the pad
shortish and angling across off, forward and tipped to short cover. Taylor sends Latham back
slightly overpitched and outside off, Latham leans into a handsomb front-foot drive, but Plunkett stops it with his boot
full and straight, driven away, but short midwicket throws himself to his left to intercept the ball
picked off the hips towards long leg off the back foot
short and dragged down outside off, forced to sweeper cover off the back foot
was that the googly? Skids in on middle, defended from a full length
pushed through on off, tapped back to Rashid
tossed outside off and breaks away, Taylor uses his feet and chips a drive in front of short cover
Taylor shows his ace early, ventures down the track. Rashid drags his length back and slips in a wrong'un. Chopped hastily onto the ground, it bounces over Buttler's hand, and Taylor gets away
faster and flatter on the stumps, patted down to long-on
short on off, whipped behind the leg umpire off the back foot
short and angling into the body. Taylor hops and clips a single through square leg
short and outside off, Latham has a slash.. and misses
fullish and on off, tapped back past Stokes
Picked away through backward square leg once again
short, wide, there's the release...or not. Flashed straight to backward point
fullish, on the pads, clipped to the right of midwicket
a bit of flight on off stump and Latham is down the track to clip to long-on
on the pads once more, clipped to deep midwicket
flat length ball pitching on middle and spinning towards middle, goes deep in his crease to whip to deep square leg
nice length, bowled pretty quick on off and middle, Taylor can't get a big enough stretch out to drive. Clipped watchfully to straight midwicket
tossed up a bit wider, gets forward for a push to short extra-cover
back of a length, fairly close to off stump, opens his bat face and dabs to backward point
short, gets up to about shoulder height outside off stump. Pulled round to deep square leg
not quite short enough for the pull, on off stump, but Taylor's quick hands come to his rescue and he swipes it along the ground to deep midwicket
ooh, good ball. Offcutter, angling into the fourth-stump channel and nipping away. Half-forward, looks to play the angle towards wide mid-on, ends up getting a thick outside edge down to third man
shortish, angling into Taylor's body, tucked off the hip to the right of fine leg. May have just come off the hip, in fact
slower ball, back of a length and wide of off stump. Called wide after Taylor misses the cut
this one nips away from the right-hander in the fifth-stump channel. Taylor leans over the ball for a push into the covers, ends up edging thickly down to third man

and he strikes first ball, and Taylor can't review because his old pal Martin Guptill used up New Zealand's only one. Length ball angling in from wide of the crease, and Taylor, shuffling across his crease, misses one as he plays around his front leg looking to work the ball square on the leg side. To me it seemed to bounce a fair amount, and it struck him above the knee-roll. Would that have hit the stumps? Marais Erasmus thought it would have... Ball tracking says it would have missed the top of leg stump.
back of a length on off stump, defended into the extra-cover region
bouncer angling in and rising over off stump, Neesham ducks under
back of a length, angling into middle and off, defended into the covers
back of a length, angling into the batsman, who's standing on leg stump and not really going across his crease. Looks to work it leg side and misses, and the ball hits his thigh pad
beauty. Angling into the fourth-stump channel and holding its line. Neesham again stays leg-side of the ball and looks to jab at it. The ball sneaks past his outside edge
length ball outside off, with a bit of extra bounce. Slapped away to deep point

full-toss, about stump high, angling into leg stump. England are looking to deny Neesham any room here, they know he's looking to stay leg side of the ball, so they're angling it into his body. Is a little surprised by that ball and looks to jab it away, but can't put bat to ball and is hit on the thigh pad
back of a length outside off, chopped into the point region
too full on the legs, and Neesham clips it away neatly, leaving deep square leg sprawled on the floor after chasing to his right on the boundary
full, angling down leg, Neesham steps across and misses the flick
short ball, sits up at chest height outside off, and Neesham pounces on it. Opens up at the hip and pulls it away between mid-on and midwicket. Top shot
full, on middle stump, gets his front leg out of the way and drives with a straight bat to the right of mid-on
full outside off, driven crisply to short cover
length ball angling into off stump, gets nicely behind it to block it back to the bowler
bouncer rising over off stump, and Neesham gets out of the way, bending at the knees and pulling his head and shoulders away from the line
short outside off, pulled to the right of deep square leg, and now he pulls off a good diving save. Woakes the fielder
fullish outside off, not quite up there for the cover drive. Straightens a bit and beats the angled bat of Latham
back of a length on off stump, blocked back to the bowler
shortish, not too much width outside off to free the arms, jabbed to backward point

back of a length, straightens in towards middle stump. Probably another of those cross-seam balls. Jabs his bat down and the ball hits the inside half of it and drops a short distance away on the leg side. Latham calls quickly for the single, and Neesham responds immediately
slower length ball on off stump, lets it come on and dabs towards backward point
wow. That's back of a length, gets up to waist height on middle stump, and this is more of a flick than a pull from Latham, picks it up and dumps it one-bounce, over the backward square leg boundary
full now, on middle stump, clipped gently into the leg side, asking Archer to run in a fair distance  from mid-on
back of a length on middle stump. Stays leg-side of the ball and jabs into the backward point region

shot of the innings. Length ball angling into  a fourth-stump line, and he takes a small step forward, and transfers his weight perfectly into a checked push to the right of extra-cover that leaves deep point attempting a futile sprint to his left
excellent response. Similar length, but a touch shorter, and it straightens off the seam to beat the outside edge as Latham looks for another front-foot push
back of a length outside off, dabbed down to third man
back of a length, again it nips away slightly off the seam in the corridor. Neesham watches it well and plays late, dabs to backward point
good bouncer, only gets up to about neck height over off stump, and Neesham has to duck in a hurry to get under it
length ball on off stump, stays leg-side of the ball and jabs it away to deep point
ooh, that's not a great shot. Not short enough to pull, and it's too close to off stump to be playing across the line like that. Wasn't too far away after he missed
back of a length close to off stump, dabbed towards third man
length ball slanting away from off stump, punched off the front foot to deep point
length ball angling away from off stump, opens his bat face and glides it fine of third man

back of a length, pretty close to off stump, and Neesham plays that really well. Stands tall and forces it away to the right of extra-cover. Didn't have much room to free his arms, but he's easily beaten deep point to his left

boundary, wicket. There's that Plunkett cross-seamer that doesn't quite come onto the bat as expected. Fullish on off stump, but it sits up a little off the pitch, and Neesham just doesn't time that attempted loft over mid-on. Comes off the bat with a weird clunk, and Root takes a straightforward catch at mid-on. Three wickets now for Plunkett. What a final he's having.
back of a length outside off, steered down to third man
back of a length outside off, de Grandhomme is off the mark with a chop to the right of third man

that ball is the definition of 'hard length'. It's pitched outside off, and de Grandhomme swivels into a pull, but it hits the bat jarringly high, and rolls gently to midwicket instead of pinging away to the boundary
full now, on middle and leg, clipped away with terrific timing to the right of deep square leg, where Bairstow makes a super diving save
back of a length, nips back in off the seam. Looks to dab into the off side for one, but ends up inside-edging into his thigh pad
fullish, close to off stump, jabbed to the left of extra-cover
back of a length, nips away like a legcutter in the corridor. No footwork from de Grandhomme, pokes at it and the feet follow after the ball has gone past his outside edge
bouncer over off stump, and de Grandhomme, who had initially shuffled across to get into position to hook, decides in the end to duck
slower ball on off stump, clipped towards deep midwicket

short ball angling away from off stump, pulled to deep midwicket. That's the extra fielder on the boundary - and two successive balls have been hit there, once by the right-hander and once by the left-hander
lovely slower ball, back of a length close to off stump. Again there's no feet from de Grandhomme, pushes at it and misses

ooh, well bowled. Fuller now, another legcutter, pitching on off stump. CdG looks to whip through midwicket, and at the last moment checks himself, and the ball squirts along the ground to short cover off the leading edge. End of a fantastic, and possibly match-defining 10 overs from Plunkett
length ball on leg stump, clipped to the left of mid-on
another legcutter beats the leaden-footed de Grandhomme's outside edge. Back of a length, in the corridor, and he simply pushes at it with his hands

ouch! Follows up with a slippery short ball on off stump. Gets up above the right shoulder, and de Grandhomme top-edges his hook into the top of his helmet, just above the badge, and the ball pops up in the air but safely to the left of backward point. Out comes the physio to check on de Grandhomme
full, angling away from off stump, driven to the right of mid-off
full on off stump, driven firmly and straight to mid-off, and they chase the quick single anyway. Makes it safely to the danger end in the end
slower ball, full, ends up outside leg stump, and Latham swings too early through the attempted flick
bouncer over middle and off, Latham ducks low to evade it
full on the pads, clipped to long leg
slower length ball on off stump, lets it come and dabs behind point with an open face

ooh, that's a difficult bouncer to deal with. Wide of the crease, angling into the stumps, and in the end it only probably gets up to shoulder height, and de Grandhomme ducks awkwardly. Hits his left shoulder and ricochets beyond the reach of the keeper trying to leap up to his left with one glove extended. Evasive action, so it counts as leg byes

drifts onto the pads and he clips it away towards long leg. They see it's Rashid fielding it and immediately decide on running two. The throw isn't the strongest, and Buttler has to leave his post by the stumps to collect it on the bounce
slower ball, back of a length outside off, chopped down to third man

shuffles across to off stump and Wood slants his short ball wider. Has to fetch the pull from outside off, from shoulder height, and he hits it uppishly, but fortunately for him without too much power, so it doesn't carry anywhere near deep midwicket coming in off the boundary
slower ball, fullish and on middle stump, clipped to the left of mid-on
slower ball, shortish, just outside off. Swings too early into the pull, and the ball hits him on the back and ricochets towards third man. Third blow to his body today?
head-high bouncer over off stump. Stays leg-side of it and tennis-smashes it into the midwicket region
slower bouncer outside off, and de Grandhomme sways out of the way. Not sure he picked the change of pace. Signalled wide, though, and that brings up New Zealand's 200
digs it in short outside off, extra bounce imperils the flat-bat slap, and he top-edges it, but the ball doesn't balloon far enough for Stokes, running in from point, to be able to catch it
he's hit on the back for the second time this over. Another slower short ball outside off, and again he swings too early on the pull. Runs away to third man for a leg bye
attempts the yorker this time, ends up bowling it down the leg side, past the attempted flick
third wide of the over. Bouncer, Latham ducks, but it's the line that's the issue - outside leg - rather than the height
back of a length on off stump, gets back and across and tucks it into the square leg region
slower length ball, angling away from off stump. Looks to step across and swipe it away through midwicket, but the angle only allows him to play it to mid-on
hits that hard length and slants it away from off stump. Can't drive, can't pull, so he ends up playing an in-between diagonal bat swat, and can't put bat to ball
what a shot. A touch too full this time, on leg stump, and he clears his front leg slightly and whips it up and over wide long-on
another blow to the body. Slower short ball, swivels through the pull too early and is hit on the stomach

bouncer, gets over shoulder height and he hooks a little uppishly, but into the gap to the right of fine leg. de Grandhomme wants the second, he's sent back, and a more accurate throw to the keeper might have ended his innings. As it happened, Buttler had to run towards the silly point area to collect, and then he spun around and threw the stumps down, and the batsman was juuuust in
bouncer, CdG ducks under it
back of a length on off stump, opens up and whips it away to deep midwicket
low full-toss on the stumps, and de Grandhomme gets his feet out of the way to whip to the left of deep midwicket
slower ball, full, on off stump, clipped towards deep midwicket

shortish, angling into the body. Looks to step across outside off and whip towards fine leg, but all he manages is glove onto thigh pad, and the ball lobs up gently and drops a few feet short of the keeper
looks to make room this time, can't get any power on this full slower ball on the stumps, jabs it along the ground to mid-on
slower bouncer over off stump, swivels too early through the pull and misses
full, slanting away from off stump, slower ball, driven to the right of mid-off
slower ball, back of a length on off stump, gets across to clip to the left of fine leg
back of a length on off stump, looks to work it wide of mid-on, initially, but adjusts once the ball straightens off the seam. Off the leading edge towards backward point
shuffles across early and Woakes slants a slower length ball wider outside off. Swiped away to deep square leg
another slower ball, on the fuller side of a good length on off stump, and de Grandhomme's struggle ends. Looks to whip it over mid-on, plays too early, and balloons a leading edge to mid-off instead
slower length ball on off stump, clipped to deep midwicket
slower length ball on off stump, clipped away into the backward square leg region. They think of two, but the fielder is off the boundary in a flash to close down the ball
shortish ball on off stump, gets on his toes to dab towards backward point
bouncer rising fast and steep over leg stump. Latham has no option but to duck
slower ball, ends up as a full-toss wide of off stump. Slapped to extra-cover on the 30-yard circle
low full-toss outside off, jabbed towards mid-off
slower short ball over off stump. Looks to pull, and ends up dragging it to fine leg off the toe end

appeal for lbw as Latham looks to shuffle across and whip it leg side. Probably pitched outside leg, I reckon, but England have reviewed. The batsmen sneaked a risky leg bye, and Latham would have been out at the non-striker's end, by a number of feet, had Woakes hit direct, but he missed. Yup, it's pitched well outside leg stump.
slower length ball close to off stump, slanting away, swatted away to deep midwicket

slower bouncer wide of leg stump, and it's run away for five wides. Latham had no option but to leave it, and the ball bounced a second time before reaching Buttler, who'd sidestepped to his right to get behind the ball, only for it to beat him with turn

gone, a third wicket for Woakes. England haven't allowed the lofted hits over mid-on/mid-off/extra-cover, and this slower ball, which ends up as a low full-toss outside off stump, is also a hard one to put away. Hits low on the bat as Latham looks to go over mid-off, but he only succeeds in spooning it to the fielder. He goes for 47 - a scrappy innings, which could prove valuable for New Zealand if this pitch remains two-paced
whoops, high full-toss, and Woakes will get a warning for this. Slanting across the left-hander, ends up hitting Santner's left shoulder as he aims to swat it away into the leg side
another slower ball, full and angling away from off stump. Santner swings early, looking to slog over midwicket, and misses
full, close to off stump, driven along the ground to mid-off and they chance the quick single. A direct hit from Wood could have had Santner in trouble at the non-striker's end

boom! A rare ball in the slot, angling into off stump, and he clears his front leg and wallops it over midwicket, one bounce and over the rope. Most of England's other 'full' balls have been off-pace, and/or too full to get underneath
slower bouncer over leg stump. Shuffles across and looks to hoick it towards fine leg, misses

in the blockhole on off stump, makes room and stabs to extra-cover. Another risky single - they have to take all of them - and another failure to hit the stumps. Santner has to slide home, and he may have hurt himself in the process. Seemed a little worse for the wear initially, but he looks okay
slower bouncer, and Henry misses the attempted tennis-swat over square leg. Wided for height
top of off. Well, usually fast bowlers look to hit top of off on the bounce, and Archer's simply hit it on the full. Looks to clear his front leg and slog it away, but can't put bat to ball
slower yorker, angling into middle and leg. Looks to make room, can't find any, stabs it back to the bowler
looks to make room again and Archer follows him with a blockhole ball. Jabbed to mid-off

ha. Kind of sums up the latter half of New Zealand's innings, this ball. Santner ducks under a slower bouncer over leg stump. Then he thinks of stealing a bye and decides against it. Archer is just so deceptive, you can't blame Santner for it

gone first ball? No? Marais Erasmus doesn't think it's out, but that looked pretty close, and New Zealand have reviewed... It's the trademark Boult inswinger from left-arm over, past Roy's attempt at a straight-bat drive to mid-on. No inside edge... Pitching on around middle stump, and it's umpire's call on leg stump! Roy survives. Just. What saved him, I think, was that he was playing with a straight bat. If he'd gone further across with his front leg and played across it, the umpire might have been more inclined to give it out
full again, more off-stumpish this time. Pushes at it with firm hands and it runs down to third man off the outside half of the bat
fullish, fourth-stump channel, straightens slightly. Left alone
back of a length, holds its line outside off, defended off the back foot
looks to flick, ball swings past his inside edge and hits his pad, but this one's clearly missing leg stump

ooh, this one swings in from about middle and off and was probably headed for leg stump. Bairstow plays a hurried flick and the ball squirts off the inside half of his bat to that short square leg fielder
nice and full, slanting in on middle, flapped in the air...but does not carry to short midwicket
Henry chops Roy into half! Good length, angling in, swinging back in up the slope, beats the inside edge and the off stump

whoa, another cracker! On a length, comes in with the angle from over the wicket. Henry tricks Roy into playing for the angle, but it snakes away like a fast legcutter. Opens up Roy and beats the outside edge this time
Roy dashes down the track, Henry pulls his length back. Quietly bunted to mid-on
shorter and just a shade outside off, forced to mid-off
a bit too full on middle, Roy leans into this overpitched ball and drives with the full face of the bat, nutmegging YJB. Caressed straight of mid-on. Well, that was an eventful over
fuller than a good length, angling away outside off, moving past the tramline, off-side wide from Boult
Boult lets rip a full inswinger, YJB plays around his front pad and flicks to short midwicket
shorter and swings back in, Boult catches YJB in a tangle. Pings the back thigh and wanders away to cover
pitched up and angling across off, Boult encourages YJB to drive. He doesn't move his feet and drags an inside edge past leg stump

Whoa, pitches around leg stump and hoops back in sharply. Near-yorker length, Roy is in a tangle, nutmegs him and fizzes through to the keeper. Was there a woody sound there? No that didn't hit the furniture
Roy gives himself some swinging room, Boult goes shorter and outside off. Roy stays leg-side of the ball and clatters it away between covers and point. That's some riposte
back of a length and on the stumps, Roy stands tall and punches the ball straight of mid-off
good length and angling in from over the wicket, but does not threaten off stump. Left alone in the channel

fuller, angling in towards off, then straightens away late. That's how he got Rohit in the semi-final. That's how he has got a lot of wickets this World Cup. This does too much to scratch the outside edge
full on the pads, picked away through square leg
good length, angling in, straightens around off, Bairstow pokes off the outside edge behind point
shorter and angling into a leg-side clip to short midwicket
length ball on middle, Roy races down the track, aims to biff it over mid-on. He just about skies it over the fielder running back
pitched up and swinging into middle, clipped away to midwicket
back of a length, hoops back in on middle, thumps the back thigh and rolls to the slip cordon
on a length and outside off, Bairstow senses a scoring opportunity. He drags himself forward and drives on the up between point and the covers. Pinged off the middle of the bat
Boult responds with a well-directed bouncer on leg stump, forces the batsman to duck under it
swinging full-toss outside off, Bairstow latches onto this loose ball and creams it between covers and mid-off this time
shortish and around off stump, Bairstow carefully defends back to Boult to close out the over
on a length and angling in on a fourth-stump line, punched on the up to mid-off
regally punched on the up once again, this time Roy pierces the gap between covers and mid-off. He rocks forward and cracks it away
much fuller from Henry, angling in towards off and then nibbling away late to beat the outside edge. Roy gets away with the drive

this is trademark Henry! New Zealand finally have their man. Nice and full, angling in towards off stump, this is what Henry does with the new ball. He makes you play. And this ball straightens away late. Roy feels for the moving ball and nicks it off. Not too dissimilar to how Rohit was dismissed in the semi-final. Nice catch from Latham - bending forward to grab a low chance
good length and slanting in at off, Root pats it to point
much fuller and sliding in at off stump, Root covers up in defence and keeps it out
pitched up and angling across off, driven fluently off the front foot to mid-off
shorter and swinging back into the hips, deflected away to short square leg
another inswinger but Boult sends it down the leg side
good length and swings back in at middle, Bairstow sizes it up and drives it straight of Ferguson at mid-on. Nicely done by Bairstow
back of a length and angling across off, Bairstow stretches out and glides it away towards point
back of a length and slanting away outside off, too wide to draw a stroke from the batsman
fuller and closer to off, but not close enough to make Bairstow play
full and wobbles away against the angle, Root lets it go outside off
good length and angling in at off stump, Root gets right behind the line and blocks back to the bowler
full and homing in at off stump again, Root is right forward to deal with it
Root walks down the pitch and forces a a single between mid-off and the covers. He finds some breathing space at the other end
perfectly-pitched ball, angling in from off, seams away from Bairstow's bat. He drives, but how did that miss the edge?
good length and nibbles away just outside off, Bairstow does not bite this time
pitched up and angling away outside off, driven to the right of short cover and left of mid-off
shorter and zipping away into Latham's gloves, left alone in the channel
shortish and angling away just a shade outside off, fended off in front of short cover
fuller and angling across off, Bairstow shovels it with the bottom wrist but gets it only as far as Boult
hip-high short ball on off stump, Bairstow stays deep in the crease and hauls a pull to the right of the square-leg umpire
shorter, angling away, swinging after passing the batsman, who had let it go
good length and angling in at middle, Root taps it defensively to mid-on
Root gets on top of a short ball outside off and punches crisply to cover
good length, nibbling in at off and then swings away outside off.  Root does well not to chase the moving ball. He plays inside the line and allows himself to get beaten
full and slanting down the leg side off, grazes the pad and Latham dives behind the stumps to collect the ball
short and darts back in at top of off, stabbed back off the back foot to Henry
full, swings in at middle to mess with Root's leg-side flick. Chipped in the air to square leg
good length and wobbles away at 120ks, left alone outside off
good length and just a shade outside off, YJB is too early into a drive and spoons it in the air... but it does not carry to Williamson at mid-off
good length and nibbles away outside off, no shot this time
on a length and on a fifth-stump line outside off, run away towards point
back of a length and angling into a defensive little push to mid-on

What have you done, de Grandhomme? He has shelled a fairly straightforward return catch. Neesham has his hands on his head. Pitched up at off stump, Bairstow is early into it and chips a drive. The bowler can't close his hands around it. Pops in, hits the mid-riff, and pops out. What a moment in the game
shorter and outside off, run away to point
back of a length and outside off, punched through the line to mid-off
on a length and angling in at off, Root hangs back and defends
on a length and outside off, Root stretches out and drives off the inside half to mid-on
back of a length and curves in from over the wicket, Root chops at it but the ball sneaks under his bat
yorker, tails in at leg stump from over the wicket, Root is opened up as he scoops a leading edge to cover. That's three maidens in a row.
YJB breaks the sequence of dots by tucking this length ball on middle into the midwicket region
looks like an offcutter outside off, really full, jammed to mid-off
full and wobbles in at off, driven back to the bowler. De Grandhomme throws himself to his right to stop the ball
Root walks down the track and works this with the angle through midwicket. Latham needs to be whisked in to stop the batsmen from leaving the crease
back of a length and angling into off, Bairstow shuffles across off and works to short midwicket
short and angling in at middle, stands tall and punches a single down to long-on
full and slanting in on middle, forward and driven to mid-on
on a length and outside off, YJB yanks his bottom hand off the bat and splices to mid-off
good length, angling in towards off and bends away in the channel. YJB shows restraint in shouldering arms
overpitched on middle, too straight, Henry searches for the big inswinger. Bairstow loads up and flicks it powerfully through midwicket
just short of a good length and outside off, YJB throws his bat at the ball and inside-edges it past leg stump and into the fine-leg boundary. Fifty up for England
back of a length and angling into a gentle push to the right of short midwicket
back of a length and just a shade outside off, jabbed back to the bowler
back of a length and angling into a smooth push down to Boult at long-on
full and outside off, Root stretches out for a drive and caresses it away to the left of short cover. Sweeper cleans it up in the outfield
short and just a shade outside off, Root glides it behind Neesham at point
full and swings back in on middle, flicked in the air... but does not carry to Taylor at short midwicket
back of a length and wide outside off, Root slashes and edges it behind to Latham
banged in short and slanting in from outside off, Bairstow flashes...and misses
lifter angling down the leg side as YJB ducks under it. Wide called
splice-jarring length, the line is outside off, stabbed to cover
short and outside off, punched to the covers
overpitched and outside off, YJB laces it away but Williamson throws himself to his left at extra-cover to intercept the ball
chest-high short ball on middle, Root pulls along the ground to Guptill at leg-gully
Root jumps on top of a short ball outside off and slices it away to deep third man
full and wobbling in at middle, Root is caught playing around his front pad and falls over the flick. This seems to be heading down the leg side
Root loses his patience. He runs down the track, has a wild leg-side mow, and just collects thin air

Root searches for the release and instead edges de Grandhomme behind. Routine catch behind the stumps for Latham. Good length and swings away wide outside off, Root chases a drive, plays a long way away from the body and tickles it to the keeper. Credit to Henry too - he gave up just one run off 18 balls to Root
length ball slanting across to off stump. Waits on it and dabs to third man to get off the mark
length ball, a bit of inward nip towards off stump. Good stride forward to defend
another good length ball on off stump, and Bairstow blocks it back down the pitch, towards the non-striker
back of a length, angling across to off stump, stabbed towards backward point with an open face
length ball on middle stump, stays leg-side of the ball and steers it past the diving backward point fielder. Third man has a long way to run to his left, and they hurry through for two

full now, and Morgan plays around it while attempting to flick. No lbw appeal, because it pitched outside leg. Morgan's back foot is staying resolutely on leg stump, and possibly moving away as well. Moving from middle stump to leg stump, in fact, as replays show
bouncer now, over leg stump. Morgan ducks under
bouncer, homing in on Morgan's front shoulder. An ungainly whipped hook, manages to keep it down in front of fine leg
full, angling into middle stump, punched to mid-on

down the track and CdG floats a slower ball wide of off stump. Reaches out to try and launch it over mid-off, doesn't middle it, and it lands juust beyond Williamson's reach as he turns around and gives chase
slower offcutter outside off. Comes forward to try and dab behind point, ends up playing inside the line and getting beaten
down the track again and CdG bowls back of a length this time, looking to cramp Morgan. Jabbed into the covers
shortish, a bit of width, can't get that square cut past backward point
short ball on leg stump, leg-stumpish, pulled round to long leg
loopy slower ball, ends up as a full-toss on middle stump. Looks to whip it away but can't get it past short fine leg
shortish, tucked off the hips to fine leg
length ball outside off, and that's a beautiful shot from Bairstow, bat meeting ball on top of the bounce and whippy wrists forcing it past the cover fielder to his right

bowled 'im! Back of a length, close to off stump, too close to be trying to force away square on the off side. Jumps up to ride the bounce, jabs at it with an angled bat, and inside-edges onto his stumps. Ferguson now has more middle-overs wickets than any other bowler at this World Cup. He's gone past Mitchell Starc
shortish, too straight, whipped off the hip to fine leg
shortish on middle and leg. Morgan is leg-side of the ball again, hops to ride the bounce and block it back to the bowler
back of a length on off stump, jumps and punches to deep point
fullish, angling across to off stump, driven to sweeper cover
length ball, fifth-stump line, left alone
down the track and de Grandhomme hits a shorter length than Stokes wants. He ends up in no-man's land, looking to defend, and the ball straightens past his outside edge
looks to step out again, and de Grandhomme slides down the leg side in an attempt to cramp him for room with a full one
shortish, fairly wide of off, and Stokes plays and misses, looking to punch it square. Sticks in the pitch a little and nips away off the pitch
back of a length on off stump, blocked back to the bowler
down the track again and again de Grandhomme's length is shorter than Stokes would like, angling into him. Stretches out and blocks it back to the bowler
in the blockhole on middle stump, jabbed back to the bowler
back of a length on leg stump, stays leg-side of it, hops, and defends back to the bowler

that's a brute of a bouncer at 145kph, and it nearly decapitates Morgan as he falls over backwards, onto his backside, to evade it. The umpires are checking for something... Having a word with Morgan, checking if he's okay, basically. It grazed his helmet as it went through, and Morgan took his eye off the ball
full, too straight, misses the flick but picks up leg byes to the left of fine leg
back of a length on leg stump, stays leg-side of the ball and blocks it back to Ferguson

another bouncer, slanting across over middle stump this time, and Morgan can keep his eye on it and sway away. The bouncer is too hot to handle for Tom Latham, however, and it eludes his gloves as he jumps up, arms outstretched
back of a length on off stump, chopped to cover point
fullish, angling into middle stump, blocked back to the bowler
back of a length on off stump, stands tall and chops it away on top of the bounce, but this is a slow pitch and he can't really hit it square. Drags it to extra-cover
down the track again, and though he doesn't get close to the pitch of the ball, this time it's short enough for him to whip it away through square leg, with a strong swivel at the hips
back of a length on off stump, blocked back to the bowler
length ball, a bit of inward movement towards middle stump. Defended solidly towards midwicket with the straightest of bats
back of a length on middle stump, defended to mid-on

and he strikes first ball! Or he will have, if this catch is deemed to be clean. What a bit of work on the point boundary from Lockie Ferguson! Wide length ball, carved away in the air, and Lockie sprints in from the boundary, throws himself forward, and grabs it two-handed, perfectly clean, a couple of inches off the ground. The soft signal was out, but the soft signal doesn't matter at all, because the replays were so conclusive. We've seen some outstanding catches at this World Cup. This is among the top three. Or four. Or five. Or one.
back of a length, angling into the legs, tucked away through square leg
length ball outside off, nice stride forward for a push into the point region
fullish, slanting away into a sixth-stump line. Go ahead, drive me, says Neesham. Stokes leaves it alone
again he angles across into that wide line, dangling it up pretty full. Again Stokes ignores the bait

ooh, what a delivery! Neesham was so delighted that it seemed initially like he was celebrating a wicket. Back of a length, slanting away before nipping back wickedly off the seam. Stokes doubles over as he jabs down on the ball, which beats his inside edge and soars over off stump
length ball on off stump, clipped to deep square leg
length ball outside off, opens his bat face to guide it to third man
length ball close to off stump, Buttler uses those wrists to work it to deep square leg
full, angling into middle stump. Holds up on the pitch a little, and Stokes is aware of the possibility and defends with the full face showing, to mid-on
back of a length on off stump, lets it come and defends
a bit fuller on middle stump, clipped to deep square leg

full, angling away into that wide line again. This time he gets a big stride forward and across to drive to the left of deep point. They run a second, and there's a brief recourse to the third umpire to see if Stokes beat the throw home to the keeper. He had, comfortably
full on off, driven to mid-off
length ball, straightens a touch towards off stump as Stokes comes forward to defend. Hits the inside half of the bat, high up, and ricochets into front pad
length ball slanting across towards off stump, gets half-forward to block down the pitch
down the track and Neesham bowls a back-of-a-length ball slanting across Stokes, who punches crisply to deep point
length ball outside off, nice stride forward for the checked drive to the right of deep point
length ball wide of off stump, left alone
length ball angling into middle stump. Stokes plays the checked drive to mid-on, and it hangs in the air briefly. The ball's stopping a lot now
back of a length, close to off stump, waits on it and dabs to backward point
length ball angling into middle and leg, clipped towards midwicket
back of a length outside off, punched to extra-cover

extra bounce, and was there an edge? No idea, but Latham puts it down, standing up to the stumps. Length ball outside off, and the bounce sneaks it past - or grazes - Stokes' outside edge as he looks to push into the covers with an angled bat. We'll need to see replays
back of a length, angling into middle stump, worked away through square leg
back of a length outside off, this ball on this pitch comes on to the bat too slow for Stokes to slap it through point, ends up hitting it to cover instead

down the track and that's serious power. Gets fairly close to the pitch of one angling away from him, and the angle allows him to free his arms. Flat-bats it hard past the bowler's right hand, making umpire Dharmasena take cover
shortish, down the leg side, can't connect with the flick off the hip
down the track again and Neesham shortens his length, bowls it at Stokes' body. Pulled off the hip to deep square leg
slower length ball outside off, Buttler gets a nice stride forward to drive, and short extra-cover dives left to stop it
back of a length, legcutter in the fifth-stump channel. Punched to deep point
back of a length close to off stump. Looks for the push into the covers and it holds up on the surface and rolls through square leg off the inside edge
fullish, angling into middle and leg. Looks to flick, closes his bat face early, and the ball goes rolling to mid-off off the leading edge
back of a length outside off, dabbed down to third man
length ball on off stump, punched to short extra-cover

ooh, what a delivery. Length ball, pitching outside off and nipping in like an offbreak. Comes forward to drive through the covers, leaves a gap between bat and pad, and it sneaks through and doesn't miss off stump by much. Ricochets off Latham's glove into the fine leg region
fullish outside off, not full enough for the big drive over the covers, and he slices it off the outside half of the bat, in the air, but safely short of third man
back of a length angling across to off stump, worked away through square leg
back of a length on off stump, worked with the angle to the left of midwicket, who makes a diving stop but lets the ball get away from him briefly, allowing the single
fullish outside off, shuffles across and blocks to short extra-cover
length ball slanting away from off stump, punched on the up to the off-side sweeper. Buttler's timed the ball better than pretty much anyone else today, so far.
back of a length, close to off stump, dabbed to backward point
back of a length outside off, a bit of width to free his arms and drive to the right of mid-off
flat, angling away from off stump, and it goes on with the arm after pitching. Looks to cut, can't connect, may have been playing for turn
lovely length, slanting across to off stump, not much turn, blocked back to the bowler
flat length ball speared across towards off stump, stays back, opens up, and punches to long-on past a diving short midwicket
back of a length on off stump, goes back to work it towards deep square leg
floated across to off stump, a little slower than the previous balls. Waits on it and punches to long-on
loopy full ball on middle stump, clipped to long-on
back of a length, angling away from off stump, punched to deep point
back of a length on off stump, punched to the right of mid-off

ooh, in the air, but in the gap too. Short, not a whole lot of width, but Buttler gets off his feet, rides the bounce, and carves it away to the right of backward point. Guptill's the fielder there, though, and his athletic dive and one-handed stretch make it look like a chance when it probably wasn't
not short enough to pull, inside-edges onto the pad instead
fullish outside off, reaches out to drive to mid-off
back of a length, fourth-stump line, punched to the right of the cover sweeper
length ball close to off stump, stays on the back foot for a punch into the covers
flat, looks to bowl the lbw ball, ends up spearing it down the leg side
shortish outside off, slapped away to sweeper cover
length ball on middle stump, goes back for the punch to long-on but Guptill intervenes with a dive from short midwicket
on the pads, worked the other (left) side of Guptill towards deep square leg
nice length, flat one angling into middle and leg. Defended with bat well in front of pad - he knows the threat of lbw given how few balls he actually turns
length ball on the stumps, defended into the on side
down the track, and he ends up reaching for the fullish one slanted across him. Sliced in the air, on the bounce to the left of third man
down the track again and Henry shortens his length, pulled to the right of deep square leg
length ball wide of off, goes deep in his crease to carve to the left of third man
full outside off, gets forward for the drive to deep point to bring up the half-century stand
back of a length outside off, lets it come on and guides it down to third man

ooh. Back of a length, angling into off stump. Looks to work it with the angle into the leg side, closes his bat face early, and pops a leading edge back towards the bowler. Doesn't carry to him, though, despite a dive forward
skidding into the hips, back of a length, tucked away to the left of Neesham at short fine leg
shorter and sliding across off from round the wicket, jabbed away to the left of Neesham at point
non-turner on off stump, driven down to long-off off the front foot
tossed on the pads, knocked to backward square leg
pushed through on middle and leg, bunted down to long-on
slider on off, shortish, Buttler goes deep in the crease and whips it to midwicket
short and slanting in at off stump, Stokes stands up tall and punches to midwicket
back of a length and holds its line outside off, Stokes rolls out a back-foot punch to the off-side sweeper
slower variation from Henry. Back of a length, 121ks, cuts in, beats the inside edge as well as the off stump

Buttler plays around his front pad, trying it work it over the leg side, and falls over. Umpire Dharmasena shakes his head. Not given out lbw. Williamson challenges the on-field not-out decision. This seems to be heading down leg, though. Nicely pitched up, veers back in to ping the front pad below the knee-roll in line with middle and leg. Yup, that's missing leg stump and Dharmasena (finally) gets it right
short and angling into middle, punched past the right of Neesham at short midwicket. Ferguson swoops down on the ball in the outfield. Stokes is wary of it and sends Buttler back
shorter and outside off, punched through the line to the left of Neesham at short cover
short, wide, wider than a set of stumps outside off. Buttler brings his fast hands into play and rifles a cut behind point. Bam!
back of a length and outside off, Buttler has to reach out for the ball again, spliced in the air over point as this does not come onto the bat
short and angling in at the body from round the wicket, Stokes swivels on the back foot and pulls down to fine leg
pitched up and outside off, driven off the front foot to short cover
Ferguson runs in hard, hits the deck harder, back of a length on off, stabbed back to him
short and climbing in at off stump, Buttler hops and fends it off towards short midwicket
shortish and outside off, punched to the right of short cover
Stokes runs at Neesham and is cramped by a short ball just outside off. Stokes aims to bosh it through the covers and instead sends an inside edge past leg stump to fine leg
short and outside off, slower ball, Stokes leans back and smears it away to sweeper cover
chipped in the air over the non-striker's head as this length ball on middle stops on Buttler and messes with his timing
looks like a legcutter from Neesham, 115ks, Buttler checks his drive and chips it beautifully in the air straight of mid-on for four. Rousing stroke from Buttler
back of a length and outside off, Buttler clatters it through the line but finds cover
banged in short and slanting in just a shade outside off, Stokes leaps and rides it out to point
more short stuff from Ferguson, dug in outside off, Stokes rolls out the swivel-pull. Cracked hard onto the ground and the ball skedaddles away to the fence
back of a length and homing in at top of off, Stokes' tight defensive technique intervenes
full-toss, slanting in at leg stump, bunted to Henry at long-on
overpitched and outside off, shovel-driven with the bottom hand down to long-off
back of a length and angling into a front-foot punch to mid-on
just short of a good length and outside off, Buttler gets on top of it and laces it to sweeper cover
looks like the offcutter from Henry, grips and bounces outside off, Stokes arches his back and gets out of the way of harm
back of a length and on the hips, tucked away to deep midwicket
short at the hips, nudged through square leg for one more
back of a length and angling in on a fourth-stump line, no movement in the air or off the seam, forced down to long-on

There goes Jos the Boss. Third man is in the deep, but it does not matter as long as you can scoop the ball fine of him. Fullish and outside off, Buttler, premeditated, jumped a long way across off and Buttler-ed it away to the boundary. Buh-bye, Henry
mighty full and angling across off from over the wicket, stabbed back to the left of Ferguson
dug in shorter and fizzing away outside off, Stokes rises on top of the bounce and punches the ball to short cover
back of a length on middle, 145ks, Stokes jabs it right back to Ferguson
short and shoved down the leg side. Is the pressure getting to Ferguson and NZ?
short on the hips, Stokes picks it away to deep midwicket off the back foot
rapid bouncer outside off, 147ks, Buttler thinks about a hook, but bails out belatedly and rocks out of the way. Prancing delivery from Ferguson
slower full ball on middle, barely 125ks, tapped down to long-on
slower legcutter outside off, 112ks, Buttler smears it away to sweeper cover
full around off from round the wicket, whisked away but Taylor swoops down on the ball at short midwicket
full and angling into the pads, picked away between long leg and deep midwicket
terrific inswinging yorker, Stokes topples over and falls on the floor. But he manages to stab it out to the leg side
Neesham searches for another inswinging yorker, he misses it marginally, Stokes can't flick it away and wears it on the pad
slower, short ball outside off, Stokes sizes it up and smites it off the back foot to sweeper cover
short and angling across off, punched to Williamson hanging back at mid-off. Williamson can't throw the stumps down from the edge of the circle
a bit too full and outside off, Buttler drills it away straight of Henry at long-on
lifter, angling across off, 143ks, Stokes watches it before ducking under it
another top yorker on off, this time from Ferguson, jabbed down to mid-off
Buttler is a freak. Really full on middle, slower ball at 112ks. Buttler had jumped across off, but he delays his scoop and gets it away fine of long leg
full and wide, Ferguson cranks up to 148ks, Buttler reaches out for the ball and scythes it down to deep third man
fullish on off from over the wicket, struck to short cover off the front foot
pitched up and on off stump, Buttler clears his front leg and launches it like a bazooka. Up and over midwicket. Buttler raises cool fifty under pressure
shorter and climbs steeply outside off as Buttler has a crack at it...and misses
very full on middle, Buttler responds with a jabbing drive to mid-off
full-toss on off, stabbed down to long-on and Stokes gets to a half-century of his own. He barely celebrates
pinpoint leg-stump yorker, Buttler manages to dig it out to cover
slower ball on leg stump, shortish, Stokes swivels into a pull and drags the ball to long leg
full-toss outside off, Buttler gets his hands low once again and hoists it up and over a leaping extra-cover. Low hands, high impact from Buttler

Boult tears across from square-ish third man, slides on his knees and cuts it off. Outstanding work in the deep from Boult. This was the slower variation from Ferguson. Full and outside off, carved away. This was destined to reach the boundary until Boult intervened
lifter outside off, gets big on Buttler, who aims to force it through the off side. No dice. Beaten

It's that man Lockie Ferguson who breaks the stand and the game open for New Zealand. Buttler holes out to Southee, the sub, at sweeper cover. Slower variation once again from Ferguson, 123ks, full and outside off. He asks Buttler to manufacture the pace for himself. Buttler just skews it in the air. Southee initially misjudged the flight of the ball. He moved to his left, then to his right, then sprinted in to grab a pressure catch sliding on his knees
short and zipping away outside off, Ferguson ramps the pace and beats the outside edge. Stokes aims to dink it down to third man, but  nah you can't touch it
good length and angling in at off stump, gently dabbed to point
slower ball, full on middle, Woakes can't quite get underneath it. Hit straight of long-on
back of a length and angling in to catch the pad. Stokes has an almighty leg-side mow, loses his shape and does not make contact. Off the pad and wanders away towards point
slower and wide outside off - wider than a set of stumps outside off - slashed away to sweeper cover
slower ball outside off, Woakes stays leg-side of the ball and slices it down to deep third man

pretty full and slanting in at off stump, Stokes brings his bottom hand into play and shovels it away to the right of deep midwicket. Almost looked like the left-hander's version of Dhoni's helicopter. Muscled away

Two in two for Ferguson! Is this the game? Banged in short on off stump, rushes Woakes for pace, and draws a top-edge as the batsman sets up for a hook. The ball drops from the London skies, a nervous Latham makes a fairly simple catch looks difficult. He keeps his eyes on the ball and clings onto it in the end
short and angling across off, spliced to Williamson at the edge of the circle at mid-off
delightful offcutter from Ferguson, 122ks, grips and sneaks in, beating the inside edge
another slower ball on middle, picked away straight to midwicket
back of a length and angling into middle, Plunkett sizes it up and slugs it over midwicket. He absolutely middled that, Plunkett
Ferguson finishes his spell with another magical slower ball outside off, Plunkett does not spot it. He swings waaaaay too early, loses his shape, and watches the ball float to Latham
muscled away between deep midwicket and deep square leg. Boult searches for a yorker, but misses his length marginally. Stokes gets under it and launches it over the boundary like a boss
near-yorker on leg stump, squeezed away behind square. Henry hunts down the ball at long leg

length ball on middle, clubbed away to the right of long-on. Santner swoops to his right and collects the ball. He made a similar superb stop at the edge of the boundary against India. NZ are switched on under pressure. Stokes stands between them and WC glory
short and angling across off stump, Plunkett aims to bosh it over the leg side. He can't touch it and that's a dot
full-toss on leg stump, Plunkett pumps it in the air, but it does not carry to Santner at long-on. He tears across to his left and collects the ball
middle-stump yorker from Boult, squeezed down to long-on. Santner in the thick of the action once again. He hunts down the ball and keeps it to one
slower legcutter, finishes on leg stump, hauled away to the left of deep midwicket. Nicholls moves swiftly to his left and gathers the ball in the outfield
inch-perfect leg-stump yorker, floors Stokes, clipped to deep square leg. Neesham gets Stokes off the strike

Legcutter from Neesham, 114ks, Plunkett aims to launch it over long-off. Nope, he can't clear Boult at the boundary. This was full and outside off, Plunkett got underneath it and swung it in the air... but was done in by the lack of pace

Is that six? Yes it is! Crazy scenes at Lord's. Boult nearly pulls off a hokey-pokey catch at the edge of the midwicket boundary. He catches the ball near the boundary, but well the momentum takes his over the ad boards. His foot is on the ad board as he relays the ball to Guptill. Fine margins. It could have been a match-winning catch. Instead, it's a six. Stokes manufactures some swinging room, full on the stumps, Stokes belts it in the air...
back of a length on middle stump, punched down to long-on. Just a single for Stokes

Archer bags a first-ball duck in the final. Pressure can make you do strange things. Another legcutter variation, full on middle, Archer does not spot it. He swings for the hills, deflects this slower ball off the pad onto the stumps
yorker just outside off, jabbed to the left of extra-cover. Stokes keeps the strike as Williamson swoops down on the ball
mighty full and outside off, not quite a perfect yorker, jabbed more or less straight to Williamson at extra-cover

Whacked over midwicket. Lord's raises itself to a massive roar. Boult ditches the yorker. Slower ball, full and outside off, in the slot. Stokes drops down to one knee and smokes a slog-sweep over midwicket

It's all happening at Lord's. Full-toss on middle, smeared away to deep midwicket. Guptill attacks the ball and sets himself up for a direct hit. It might have well been a direct hit had Stokes not inadvertently deflected it away with his outstretched bat, diving forward to save himself from being run-out. The deflection ensures the ball tickles away to the boundary. It's six runs in the end. Wouldya believe it? It's ridiculous

middle-stump yorker, Stokes backs away outside leg and stabs it down to long-off. Santner hunts down the ball at long-off and throws it to Boult, who takes the bails off in ice-cool fashion. Stokes had to go for the second, he had to be on strike, but Rashid is caught short by a long way. Gone for a duck without facing a ball

Holy Moly! It's a freaking tie. We're not done yet. We will have a Super Over to decide the winner of the 2019 World Cup. This is a full-toss on middle, Boult searches for the yorker, but can't get it right, hacked down to long-on. The fielder hares in, gathers the ball. Stokes tears back for the second, Wood dishes out a desperate full-length dive, but the throw is to the bowler's end and Wood is caught metres short
